background_context.situation: Active member of the Newcomers Club, involved in various committees for three years.
background_context.environment: Nonprofit organization with a focus on community engagement.
background_context.constraints: Frequent turnover of committee members and limited institutional memory.

goals_motivations.drives: Enhancing community engagement through successful events.
goals_motivations.achievements: Organizing well-attended events, improving the user experience on the website.

behaviors_patterns.current_work: Logs into the website regularly, actively participates in event planning.
behaviors_patterns.habits: Prefers using the computer for website interactions over mobile apps.

pain_points_frustrations.obstacles: Complicated event management processes, inadequate training for new committee members.
pain_points_frustrations.frustrations: Mobile app limitations, registration discrepancies causing confusion.

needs_desires.life_improvements: Simplified user interface, better training resources, improved mobile app functionality.
needs_desires.looking_for: A more effective way to manage events and a reliable tool for communication.

attitudes_beliefs.mental_models: Values utility over aesthetics; prefers functionality in tools.
attitudes_beliefs.preferences: Favors clear, straightforward interfaces and efficient processes.
attitudes_beliefs.values: Community engagement, effective organization, and transparency in communications.

technical_comfort.tools_used: Wild Apricot application, various websites for event planning.
technical_comfort.technical_abilities: Comfortable with administrative tools and event management systems.
technical_comfort.learning_preferences: Hands-on learning with a preference for practical training.

quotes: I was impressed with the Wild Apricot application in terms of its flexibility and really the power of the whole approach.
The biggest problem I had with the whole process was dealing with people who were not savvy users.
Cleaner, simpler, better is my approach.
The training process really needs to have some hard look at two issues: the venue for training has been woefully inadequate.
